meanings.definition: The whole amount or extent of something.
meanings.sent1: The totality of the cookies in the jar was eaten by the children.
meanings.sent2: She gazed at the totality of the stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The totality of the toys in the room seemed to have a party while no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was the totality of his existence.
meanings.sent5: The totality of the storm's fury left a lasting impression on the town.

meanings.definition: The state of being complete or absolute.
meanings.sent1: The totality of his happiness was evident in his smile.
meanings.sent2: She felt the totality of peace wash over her as she sat by the calm lake.
meanings.sent3: The totality of the silence in the library was broken by a loud sneeze.
meanings.sent4: The totality of her determination carried her through the toughest challenges.
meanings.sent5: The totality of the truth finally came to light, revealing the whole story.
